data.title: Foreign Intrigue (1956)
data.meta_description: Millionaire Victor Danemore, living on the French Riviera, dies suddenly of a heart attack. His secretary, Dave Bishop, wants to know more about his employer's life. Surprisingly, not even his young wife knows anything about her husband's background or how he earned his fortune. Clues lead Bishop to Vienna and Stockholm, where he learns that Danemore was blackmailing people who cooperated with the Nazis during World War II.
data.text:
I checked out Foreign Intrigue because I saw it described as a film noir and because it appeared to have Robert Mitchum sleuthing in a raincoat, and while it delivers on the latter, it was a little more disappointing in terms of the former.

While it retains some of the hallmarks of noir—the criminal underworld, the explicit WWII fallout—it feels much more like a straight-up espionage thriller, a proto–James Bond with all its exotic foreign locations and its underground SPECTRE-esque spy rings, and just six years before Dr. No. It's clear these things were present in the collective cultural unconscious at the time.

Robert Mitchum is a strange sort of caretaker who was tasked with writing a fictional backstory for…

Listen to ScreeningNotes and I discuss this film and much more on our podcast, Movies Now and Then.

This may be one of my strangest reviews. I want to review this movie as if Alfred Hitchcock directed it. If this were to happen, I think it would have been a masterpiece, and ranked right up there with Hitch's other great works.

This is a story about a mysterious man that dies of a heart attack at the beginning of the film. Robert Mitchum plays his long time press agent that has constructed the mysterious public persona about this man and his history. Even his wife is a construct of spin. A beautiful woman played by Genevieve Page was basically hired…

The 1950s, Pt. III: 18/100

1956 Ranked

Foreign Intrigue is a stylish color noir (well not really, but that is what the Criterion Channel calls it) from director Sheldon Reynolds, an adaptation of his television series of the same name. Starring Robert Mitchum as Dave Bishop, it is not long before Bishop is caught up in the promised intrigue in Europe. From the French Riviera to Vienna and Stockholm, trouble seems to follow Bishop as he investigates the past of his now deceased boss Victor Danemore. Having served as Danemore’s press agent, hired to create a past for him, Bishop has now become curious after being asked the same question by a few men. Bishop found Danemore lying on the…
